Reviews.Title: “Made Our Trip Special”
Reviews.Author: Claude C
Reviews.Content: This is one of the older hotels on the OC Boardwalk, but it's pretty clear that the place has been renovated recently, and as hotel guests we benefit. We checked in as a split group; my wife and in-laws came earlier than I did, and the desk clerk was understanding and, while only one of the two rooms was ready at that point, he was able to accommodate them. They arranged for the key to the other room, and a parking pass, to be simply waiting for me when I arrived a few hours later. We also got lucky in that there was a cancellation that allowed us to upgrade our rooms to the ocean-side balconies in the main building. This hotel is comprised of more than one building, with the second building being set closer to the street than the boardwalk. The walk between the two buildings is maybe about 50 feet, so we're not talking about a huge hike, here. This second building also houses the indoor pool, which is a near-twin to the outdoor pool. Both pools have handicap access via a hydraulic chair lift (it doesn't currently appear in the photos on the hotel's website, so this must be a recent addition). Our room--as noted above--was an upgrade to an ocean-side room, which is a nice size and has a balcony overlooking the ocean. Because the main building is next to the Kite Loft, we had the bonus view of dozens of kites which they have anchored into the beach itself. Our room had two double beds, a pull-out sofa and a kitchenette that included a microwave, mini-fridge (4 CF unit), coffee maker, toaster, sink (with dishcloths and detergent) and a two-burner stove. (My understanding is that some units don't have the stove.) Also included were utensils and plates/cups/glasses for six people, and cooking vessels. The bathroom was a little on the small side and rather oddly laid out, but up-to-date and fully stocked with the usual amenities. Other stuff in the room included the alarm clock radio, iron and ironing board, and flat screen TV with an impressive assortment of channels. Free wi-fi internet is available; we arrived "out of season" (a week after Labor Day) so a password wasn't needed, but you still have to go to a generic OC website first. In-season, you may have to get a password from the desk clerk. I didn't see any data ports in my room so I don't think wired internet is available. Climate control is provided by a through-the-wall A/C unit. Some rooms (my in-laws') have units with digital displays and the "energy saver" mode so that the unit cycles on and off; others (mine) had an analog control and the unit remained on constantly. So in that realm, your mileage may vary a little. There's also some space available for you to leave your beach chair, boogie board, etc. without your having to trip over it. There is a safe in the closet that locks with a key rather than the usual electronic code. Personally I'd be more comfortable with the code because it's tougher to lose, but that's a minor complaint. Everyone in the hotel--EVERYONE, including guests and staff--was friendly and chatty, and none of our conversations with the staff felt like just so much empty noise. Most of the guests we encountered were repeat customers. In fact, the couple in the room next to us told me that they visit every year, and arrange to get the same room each year. It was a very familial atmosphere despite our only being there for the weekend. The hotel offers a breakfast that's a small step above the usual Continental breakfast: there are DIY waffle makers on hand, and an assortment of pastries, fruit, and stuff to toast, plus cereal and a hot option. On both days for us it was scrambled eggs and sausage, and other reviews here suggest that this may always be the option. And if you brought something of your own that needed heating, there are also a couple of microwave ovens as well. There isn't a lot of room in the breakfast prep/dining area, and this led to some unfortunately self-entitled behavior on the part of some of the other guests. Because the tables were full, we opted to eat in our room. In good weather there are also a couple of tables immediately outside the breakfast area. A few varieties of coffee are also available; and the coffee is there all day, not just during breakfast time. From a pricing standpoint, it's probably a little more than you'd expect to pay for a Comfort Inn (about $180/night), but it's in the middle range for Ocean City on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful with great location”
Reviews.Author: Chloebebe
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. Room was in big size, and we were up on the 5th floor. The balcony can see the ocean and the street. Room was clean with good size LCD TV. Breakfast was included with a lot of choices to eat. Finding a parking space was a little bit challenge for us.

Reviews.Title: “I hope you like the smell of Mildew and Chicken Wings!”
Reviews.Author: mrsscaramo
Reviews.Content: Anyone who has stayed in Ocean City knows the boardwalk hotels are not the cleanest or as nice as the ones on the higher numbered streets. This being said this hotel states that it is Oceanfront and not behind a Hooters restaurant! There is one building on the property that is Oceanfront but the rest of the buildings are scattered all over the place and we happened to be in the one that housed the indoor pool. The smell of Mildew as you entered the property is overwhelming. I just used the stairs instead of waiting for the elevator. The rooms were clean but run down. The A/C unit is a window one so it blows out onto the patio. There is a mini fridge and microwave in the room so you can store a small amount of items. Beware if you move your car and try to get a parking spot you will have to walk a few blocks, if you have just made a grocery store run can be quite the pain because you have to cross the main street to get from parking to the hotel. They offer free breakfast, but the day I went in I couldn't even find a place to sit. They fail to mention that you will be dining with all of the staff from the hotel, and after taking a good look at the cleanliness of the area where the food was put out, we opted to grab a quick bite elsewhere. This hotel is good for a weekend but I would never stay for a week. But if you are looking to be close to Hooters by all means this is where you want to be!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: StaciKing921
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn at 5th & Boardwalk has always been our go-to hotel. It isn't the fanciest by any stretch of the imagination but it's location is fabulous. We have always stayed in the building that has the "Ocean View" rooms - they are less expensive and you still have a decent view of the beach. Since I get up early I enjoy sitting on the balcony with my coffee and watching for the dolphins to swim by - and yes, I have seen them almost every time we have stayed here!!! We were sad that they didn't have any vacancies for SunFest this year so we had to find a room elsewhere - now we know to book a little earlier!! A little note - they allow smoking in some of the rooms of this building - so if you are sensative to the smell of smoke, make sure you book in the non-smoking rooms of the ocean front building!! The rooms are basic beach hotel rooms - but always clean, which is most important. They have a small fridge, some plates and utensils, a small coffee pot and wi-fi is available. Just steps from the boardwalk and beach. Easy access to the free parking (1 space per room) so leaving to go out to dinner was a breeze because there was always a space to come back to. The have an indoor and an outdoor pool - I'm not a swimmer but my husband is - he tried out the indoor pool which, at the time of our stay was little dicey...the water had a greenish tinge to it so he decided to skip it this trip...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: redaduffy
Reviews.Content: I read lots of reviews on trip advisor before settling on the Comfort Inn. It was the perfect location for my 9 yr old son. We were within walking distance of all the games and rides on the boardwalk. We had an easy walk onto the beach. The room was clean and of adequate size for two. The bathroom was small but updated. We had a 1st floor oceanfront room, which sounds great except for the noisy boardwalk at 2am. The free breakfast had several options including cereal, eggs and sausage, and pastries. Staff was not overly friendly but certainly handled all of our requests quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the first floor!”
Reviews.Author: diske1142
Reviews.Content: I checked in for three nights. I was in the pink building behind the ocean front one. 1stfloor Was given a password for the internet and could not log on. Apparently there is a different code for that building....1AM I hear a thump above me that sounded like a bowling bowl was being dropped. I called the front desk at 2AM, the desk clerk said she would take care of it. It continued and I called back at 2:25 and she said she was up and checked it out and they were quiet. She asked if it sounded like furniture being moved and I said it did and she explained it's the sliding glass patio door. Needless to say my first night was sleepless and the guest above me was up all night. Other than that, it's a nice place to stay. Comfortable beds, nice breakfast and housekeeper Don was very nice and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mln304
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this hotel. We had a room in the main building which was clean and pretty big. It had a small breakfast table, fridge, microwave, oven, sink & sofa. Our room was on the side but you could see the ocean from the balcony. There is a really nice deck right on the boardwalk with plenty of lounge chairs for a great view of people on the boardwalk and beach. The outdoor pool is really small but they also have an indoor pool in the 2nd building which I did not see. The free breakfast in the lobby was fair. Nice parking lot with plenty of space. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Carol, our housekeeper, was one of the nicest people. This hotel is a little pricey but worth it for the great location and pool deck right on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: paige w
Reviews.Content: Great location right on boardwalk steps from the beach not too far to walk to the rides & games. Indoor & Outdoor pools rooms were clean, staff friendly & helpful! The free hot breakfast was great saved a lot of $$ there. Don't know why other reviewers had problems but we never experienced any! Would definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Larlars109
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I went away for a quick 1 night getaway. Great location, far enough away from the inlet to be quiet, yet within quick walking distance to EVERYTHING!!! Hotel was clean. Side (city view, I believe) was good, you could see the ocean, yet the buildings on both sides are so close, you can't see too much else. Parking is a little tight (however, there is another lot offsite). Only 1 elevator, so somewhat timely, but only five floors, so steps worked just fine. Other than that, great place & staff helpful, polite, friendly & welcoming! We will go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Derek G
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean, staff is extremely friendly, best place to stay in OC!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greg S
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Great staff and location. Staff was freindly, Room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “EXTREMELY RUDE HOTEL MANAGER”
Reviews.Author: valynne1
Reviews.Content: I arranged rooms for 7 families for a beach soccer tournament at this hotel. Every time i called or the families booking the rooms called and were given different information. I called 3 times the week before our visit to make sure we had 7 rooms for 7 families....each time after looking at the computer for lengths of time they finally found all 7 families and each had a room....GREAT! when we checked in early we were happy to have our room ready! There was still some question about a room that didn't have a name to it... i said i squared everything before i go there and we reviewed it one more time...all good. room was clean. indoor pool small but nice. at 11:55 pm! we were alseep , we had a tournament the next day, my husband, i and 4 teenagers were awoken to the phone ringing. Night manager told us that someone had not checked into one room, i said 1 family is coming tomorrow but they had called and he mentioned one of the names... i said nope they are here and checked in, we got off the phone. i got back to sleep and 15 minutes later... OK AFTER MIDNIGHT he calls me back. i said sir, how dare you call my room 2 times at midnight and wake up my entire family ( i was NOT yelling) He yelled.... FINE I AM CHARGING YOUR CARD FOR THE EXTRA ROOM< YOU CAN PICK UP THE KEYS.... and hung up! i went down to the lobby and there was a man at the counter, on the computer. i said excuse me are you the night manager? he said .... after a pause... yes i am. I said well you just hung up on me. i started to go down my list of families and how i had called mulitple times, he wouldn't let me speaka nd proceeded to scream at me and tell me hes tired of dealing with this kind of crap! I tried to say several things but he wasn't allowing me to speak at all...so i finally screamed backa nd said are you going to let me speak?!?!?! He said fine. i told him how i had called several times, how i did my part in ensuring every room had a family and i don't understand the problem. he said i am not going to charge you for the extra room. i said your right, you aren't. another woman who works there had coming in during his yelling at me. she looked mortified! ( apparently the end of that story is that one family had changed the length of their stay and there fore were out of my block of rooms... that however was not explained to me..... until the next day by the day manager, who was much nicer to deal with and appauled that i was called at mid night!) i did call corporate after speaking with the day manager and his recommending i call... the hotel offered me 15% off my next stay at that hotel.... and i find that an unsatisfactory resolution. considering i brought over 3500 dollars to that hotel that weekend! I have written the hotel owner directly and hope that there is a better resolution and an apology. I cannot believe anyone in customer servive would speak to someone this way....especially UNPROVOKED. i did not yell at or raise my voice until i was not allowed to speak for several minutes into this mans tirade. i understand he is recently in management after many years with the company. perhaps this is not the best position for him. We did try the breakfast and my husband and i who aren't too picky couldn't eat the ice cold eggs and undercooked sausage that was cold in the middle. and the line to make waffles was 8 people deep! The noise at night from the side street was VERY LOUD until very late.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn Boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: pmshea1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and the staff was very helpful. I enjoyed my stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Michael W
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Ocean City. Full disclosure, I work in the hotel business, so I am usually very picky about where I stay. I arrived early in the morning, and was greeted by Fred, the front desk agent on duty. I knew that it would be too early to check in, but I inquired about getting a parking permit so that my family and I could park and enjoy the beach. Fred told me that would not be an issue at all, and quickly gave me a parking permit. Darren, the general manager, came out to the desk, warmly greeted me and told me that they would try to get me a room as quickly as possible. I certainly did not expect that since check in is at 3pm. Ten minutes later, Fred handed me our room keys and sent us on our way. The room was beautiful. Large enough for my family of four to be comfortable, with no feeling of being cramped. Not only was the room of a good size, but it included a small stove-top, with pans, as well as silverware, a sink and microwave. The room was very clean, and the housekeeping staff was extremely nice, welcoming and quick to assist in any way. James, our housekeeper, was especially nice. As we were leaving our room on our second day, he asked us if we were leaving and if we would like service. He did not knock on our door at any time, and was very patient with my family. Chris, the night time manager, was also very friendly and I spent almost 30 minutes talking with him on our first night. He was very informative about the area and was quick to answer any questions that we had. I can not say enough glowing things about Darren and Fred. They were great guys to talk to, and provided excellent customer service. I will definitely be staying at this property again. I highly recommend this hotel to any and all.

Reviews.Title: “It pays to stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Michelle H
Reviews.Content: Rooms were not as pictured. Very disappointing experience. Staff wasn't friendly. Nice location right on the boardwalk. If you can't afford a better hotel, enter at your own risk!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly R
Reviews.Content: Best customer service I have ever received at a hotel! The maids were so pleasant and sweet and were not forceful about trying to clean your room. The guys down at the front desk were so helpful and would start a genuine conversation with you while you waited for a taxi (etc). We were in room #307. Even though it said it was a city view rather than the ocean view rooms, you could still see the ocean! It's smack in the middle of the boardwalk; a great location. It's a HUGE room with tons of space. There's a couch, stove and a great king sized bed. Nothing to complain about, always clean and the staff was always there to help. Great value for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: Megan H
Reviews.Content: I Just got back from my trip i was ther during one of their Busy events Called Crusie Week i was there from Wednesday the 16th-19th i had great service the front desk was awesome with check in, the Maids were always on top of things in the morning they were ready to clean your room they were always talking to you making sure you were enjoying your stay. Over all i had a great Experience staying here i'm looking now to book for july 4th and i wouldnt want to stay anywhere else but here :)

Reviews.Title: “Bad housekeeping, Bad customer service”
Reviews.Author: Carrolnsteve
Reviews.Content: Ok I have been here 3 nights and everyday I return they have yet to clean the coffee pot. Today they just threw the bed together,couldnt even take the wrinkles out of the pillow. Pretty sure they havent vacuumed either. As far as the reception desk,, they give you dirty looks when you walk through the door.They don't even say hi when you walk by. Even worse tonite they were both in the breakfast cafe eating pizza with a girl. Could of cared less about their patrons. I have stayed at many comfort Im sorry I paid in advanced because now I cant change hotels.and Im stuck here for the remainder of my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Saturday Night's All Right for the Comfort Inn!”
Reviews.Author: sam280_
Reviews.Content: We made last minute arrangements to visit Ocean City. Booked online with a AAA discount, and sailed from Wildwood on the Ferry. I have stayed in many places in Ocean City, but never at this property. Total price came to about $94 with an ocean view, side room 411. Very nice lobby, and friendly check in. Upon entering the room, we were very surprised. It was ready to go 100% for the summer season. All painted, clean, no smell, and almost new in appearance. If I was on vacation for a week, the room would be just fine. The bed was comfy, the flat screen had many channels, and the couch was also in great condition. The kitchenette was spotless and clean, with what appeared to be new utensils, pots, dishes, etc. I have seen many kitchen units in rentals, and this was the cleanest one. The bathroom is a little small, but it was clean, well lit, and equipped. You are not supposed to spend much time there with the boardwalk just a few steps away. I missed the free breakfast, but checkout was speedy. We spent a little more time before leaving to see what we missed, and the lobby was decorated nice, free papers, vending, and in the next adjacent tower was the indoor pool. The boardwalk side outdoor pool was filled and ready, but heavy rains did not allow use. I would stay here again, even in peak season. Location is a plus, breakfast, and an indoor pool are great to have during rainy weather. The 5th Street location on the boardwalk puts many attractions, bars, places to eat, all minutes away. The balcony is large enough for several people to stand outside.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen M
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and the perfect location. Being on the boardwalk makes it a convenient location to walk to shops, restaurants and arcades. Nice oceanfront balconies, spacious rooms, and good service. Nice breakfast, though a few more tables would help. Nice to have indoor pool, especially in the off-season. Would definitely choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Subodh N
Reviews.Content: Hotel literally on the boardwalk. Chose it for the location, expecting a room that was average at best. Pleasantly surprised. Clean large rooms, well maintained facility, nice breakfasts including sausages and eggs. And friendly staff. Would recommend this venue if you want a family sized clean room on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Golf Trip”
Reviews.Author: EdLPa
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 3 nites on a golf trip. Had rooms in the side building not ocean front. Rooms were spotlessly clean and very well maintained. I believe they just redid these rooms last year when we also stayed here. Little more then a continental breakfast is offered as part of your reservation. Have been going to OC on golf trips for probably 15 years and have stayed here the last few. Cost is one of the lowest and was just as good as any of the higher priced places we have stayed in the past. Right on boardwalk plenty of parking though lot is very tight.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad....”
Reviews.Author: jhyoung
Reviews.Content: Had a balcony with nice ocean view. Efficiency kitchen was conveneint for cooking breakfast. Nothing special about the room. Had 2 double beds. Room was not too dirty, but a but worn and dated.

Reviews.Title: “A Smoking Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DiamondTiger
Reviews.Content: Oh No!!! Yes I enjoy a late night cigar on the balcony while sipping a glass of wine and I don't want to get a heavy fine for it like smokeless hotels give. No don't get me wrong nothing smells worse than cigarettes.

Reviews.Title: “Family Reunion in OC, Md”
Reviews.Author: Don P
Reviews.Content: 13 family members from md,va and pa. stayed last weekend at the comfort inn. ages 12 thru 69. Great breakfast with waffles. rooms were very clean and the indoor pool was very nice. the desk people were excellent. lots to do in OC in late october. good deals at the local shops.

Reviews.Title: “Return Trip Five Months Later - Still Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: WanderingYinzer
Reviews.Content: We were here for a family trip in April and enjoyed it so much we came back at the end of September/beginning of October. Once again, it did not disappoint. This time I took some pictures to add. We booked by phone through the hotel front desk, asking for the same rooms on the fourth floor oceanfront that we had in the spring. All except for one room they accommodated us but they kept us together, which was a plus. Right in view of the front desk staff is a television screen with a number of security of cameras of the public/hall areas. I didn't ask about their security measures but it was comforting to know that they had some security there. Maybe next time I'll inquire as to their security measures. There are four or five handicapped parking spots, and as it goes for handicapped parking spots sometimes they are available and sometimes they aren't. We saw a few vehicles parked in those spots without handicapped designation either on license plates or rear-view mirror placards. The parking lot is smoothly paved and pretty much level, with a slight grade towards the entrance, and pretty much navigable with a wheelchair. I put up some pictures of our room, and am trying to concentrate on things I didn't on my last review. The efficiency kitchen in this room is well equipped. There is a two-burner electric stovetop with an overhead vent, a small microwave, efficiency size refrigerator with a decent capacity and very small token freezer, a two-slice toaster, and a four-cup coffee maker. The sink is small but deep. There is service for four; plates, bowls, cups, tumblers, and flatware. Our kitchen was equipped with a medium sized stew pot, a small and a medium size soup pot, and a medium size frying pan, all in good shape and with a nonstick coating. There was a can opener and some cooking utensils, but not a spatula. From what was in our family's other two rooms it seems that the cooking utentils vary, so if you plan to prepare food in your room it might be a good idea to bring a few cooking utensils and a can/bottle opener just in case. There is a small bottle of dishsoap, a dishcloth and dish towel provided, along with a dish drainer. The room was clean. The bathroom was clean, and I can say this because I checked the corners. I was comfortable enough that it was well cleaned. When the air conditioner was on it had a fan that ran constantly, which got annoying. Our room was serviced/maintained by James, who had the same friendly and accomodating demeanor you would expect in a higher end hotel. Usually on our shorter stays, instead of having our room cleaned and beds made we usually just swap out towels, put our room trash out, and request paper products if needed. This was one of those short stays, and we found James cheerful, pleasant, and very accommodating. He remembered us and not only asked if there was anything we needed but knew our other family members there and asked us if we knew if there was anything they needed. Thanks James. Good job! In our room there was a table with two chairs in the seating area. The balcony is too small to have a meal on, and the seagulls seem finely tuned to anything edible so I think eating on the balcony may not be a good idea. Our room had a flat screen television, about 33", with a remote control. There was also a clock radio. The bathroom has a hair dryer, and offers some of the typical hotel fare like small bottles of shampoo, soap etc. The hotel offers breakfast, which can get a bit dicey as far as crowding goes. The breakfast area is nice, bright and clean. Aside from the usual packaged muffins and Danish, they offered a variety of coffee, tea, juice, toast, fresh fruit, and waffle batter to put on a waffle iron. We didn't try them but the fresh-made waffles smelled very good. There is a television in that area. The breakfast area can get crowded, but weather permitting there is a walkway with a seating area just outside the doors with some tables and chairs that seem to attract some very friendly people to share breakfast with. It can get a good crosswind there if it is a windy day, but during the later afternoon and in the evening it is a nice quiet place just to sit without a lot of activity around you. I'm not sure about the fresh fruit left after breakfast; one day there were only a few oranges, and the next day there were oranges and apples. I think they might leave the fruit there until it is gone. The coffee is available 24 hours and it was pretty good. The area is prime "boardwalk" and wonderful for those of us who enjoy people and people watching. The Kite Loft is next door and they always fly some lovely colorful kites on the beach in front of the hotel. Aside from the wonderful parade of people, from our balcony we saw dolphins running and there are always many boats from large to small out on the ocean or at the horizon. If you have binoculars it is a good idea to toss them in your suitcase. The sliding glass doors have no screen doors but do have a latch-type lock for security. The balconies are semi-private and though you can't see the people on the next balcony you can hear them and they can hear you if they are out there. At the time we were there there were some tiny little flies that seemed to find their way in through the doors in all three of our units. A bit of bug spray packed in a suitcase may not be a bad idea depending on the time of year. Once again, the Comfort Inn Boardwalk was all we hoped it would be. None of us had any complaints about any of our three units. We are looking forward to returning next fall.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: karamyl
Reviews.Content: I stayed labor day weekend and it was very expensive but worth the $$ for the location on the boardwalk. The only down part is the swimming pool ( outdoor) was freezing cold and the indoor pool was cold but not freezing.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DustyKitty
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times over the last few years. The staff are always friendly and helpful; we love the indoor pool, and the free continental breakfast is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel just in the boardwalk but awful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mils567
Reviews.Content: its an awesome hotel, reasonably priced considering its just right in the boardwalk of ocean city. Staff are all accomodating, the rooms are clean. But the food in the breakfast room is awful! All cards no meat or sausage or even eggs, just waffles, muffin and milk. My only complain is the hallway near the indoor pool smells like molds and chlorine mixed together. I was bothered whenever i came down and smell that hallway. Other than that its is a nice place to stay in the ocean city boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Location is it's best asset........”
Reviews.Author: ADK_Hbg
Reviews.Content: Our family (me and the wife-40's, son and his friend-12) stayed here for a long weekend (THU-SUN). The hotel itself was typical of most OCMD hotels, as it appeared to be heavily visited. The rooms were clean, but dated. The cleaning staff were very friendly and accommodating. We had an early check-in and went to our room to find out that they were still cleaning the room. The housekeeping staff were very apologetic and quickly finished the room for us. We felt that the front desk staff could have cared less if we enjoyed our visit or not. This hotel's best quality is by far it's location. Being on the boardwalk gives you tremendous advantages with access to all available activities within walking distance. Would I stay here again? Probably if the rates were more reasonable, but that is a tough find during the busy season at OCMD.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: summerlvr
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our trip to OC this year. This hotel is just the right size and very clean. I wish it wasn't so expensive. It's nice, but doesn't compare to the other hotels that are asking the same price. The housekeeping staff was very friendly and respectful. The pool is in the perfect location, but in need of new steps into the pool. I'd like to see actual steps installed instead of the wobbly ladder they have now.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: ericacarter
Reviews.Content: Our daughter's soccer team chose this hotel because it was convenient to the sand soccer tournament. The front desk was really helpful with checking everyone in. The rooms were not bad and we had an obstructed view of the ocean. The bedding was what you would expect at a Comfort Inn. The room had a fridge, microwave and toaster, which was really convenient. The breakfast was all carbs -- white bagels, mini muffins and cereal. No fruit, no eggs, no yogurt. There are plenty of places nearby to eat, so it wasn't a big deal. You are really paying for the convenience of being on the beach -- it's a Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: MDMollyMom
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel about 2 weeks before our stay. Check in was smooth and the 2 men at the front desk were pleasant and helpful. Our room faced the Tidelands Hotel but our balcony still had a semi-good view of the ocean. The hotel is also right next to the Hooters restaurant, which was a good lunch spot. We were also in the building with the indoor pool...which was not heated. The water was cool and wasn't a big bother to us adults, but my poor one year old's lips were blue by about 15 minutes in the pool. Our room was OK..we are a non-smoking family, but must have been put on a smoking floor because every time the people next door would smoke...we could smell it in our room. We had a small kitchenette with a sink, microwave, and small refrigerator which was wonderful since we have small children. The beds weren't that comfy, I think partially because the pillows were small and not very comfortable. Also, the first thing we do is check for bed bugs, and found no signs of them (whew). We also found an empty bottle behind the sofa so we are pretty sure the cleaning crew doesn't really check the entire room when they clean. There were stains on some of the towels they left us, as well as the comforter when we arrived, but housekeeping was kind to give us new. All in all, it was a decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: paperson53449
Reviews.Content: This hotel is average or below. The location is perfect, right on the boardwalk and beach. The rooms have kitchenetts that are great for familys that want to cook a few meals as the price of food at the restraunts can get pricey. The free breakfast is ALL CARBS, waffles , bagels muffins, danish, english muffins and cereal. If you get there early you might score a piece of fruit. The coffee and juice is available all day. That being said.....the hotel its self is run down with a cranky cleaning staff (one maid had the nerve to ask one of the kids for a tip!!!!) I had to clean the bathroom floor the first day myself so we could walk on it without shoes. The sleeper sofa was stained, dirty and discusting. We found cheese, dirt and someone elses CD's under it. The front desk staff was very plesant and always helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Oceanfront Room for the Money”
Reviews.Author: TrippedReview
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our kids (2, 10, 14) on Tuesday, 14 Jun 11. When selecting the room I paid particular attention to make sure I got an Ocean “Front” room vice an Ocean “View” room. There is a BIG difference. We were all tickled when we opened the door and saw such a picture perfect view. The room was clean and spacious. You can tell the hotel isn’t the newest on the Boardwalk, but it didn’t disappoint. Front desk staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The included breakfast hit the spot and got us going for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price”
Reviews.Author: PerfectBreezeTravel
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here one night as we were passing through on our road trip. The place looks a little outdated from outside but once you walk into the rooms it is nicely updated. The beds were comfy and the continental breakfast was also pretty good. No complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “This is a very nice hotel on the boardwalk and the oceanfront view was our reason for staying here.”
Reviews.Author: Retailman
Reviews.Content: Very clean and comfortable. The Nov. rates for an oceanfront room were the best we could find. Nice complimentary breakfast in the lobby-waffles, cereal, muffins, toast and fruit. Our room had a kitchenette which was nice. Plenty of parking and a short drive to the convention center. Hope to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT STAY HERE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chersherr
Reviews.Content: Every year my family takes a week to get away. This year I had to be frugile with where we stayed and because of the rates I chose this hotel. WORST mistake of my life!!!! I booked through their website (choice hotels) 2 days into our stay I noticed that the hotel charged me way more money then what was quoted, the extra charges were taxes and fees that weren't posted. The room was a mess! Dirty and old. We stood in the oceanfront building (4rooms) but had a side view (a wall of a building next to our hotel. The parking is horrible and the indoor pool smelled so bad of chemicals that you couldn't stay in the room longer than 2 minutes without getting a headach. The maid servive was a joke, they didn't clean anything,made the bed half and sprayed air freshener, the vacum didn't pick up anything and the towles had hairs and stains on them. The maids would rather corner you in the hall and ask if you wanted towels instead of just cleaning your room.The mini fridge didn't have a door on the little freezer and hardly worked. water pressure was a joke, we were on the second floor. It also takes about 10 minutes to get even the slightest amout of hot water. Flies everywhere! The balcony has no screen so in order to get air in the room you also had to have bugs too. A garbage truck hit a transformer at the hotel and it took 5 hours to get power back on,when the hotel loses power the staircases are NOT lit, completely dark,feel bad for people on higher up floors who had to leave via the staircase,it was hard enough for me carrying my 2yr old down without falling. There are NO laundry services there, you have to go to a laundry mat 2 blocks away that charge crazy prices. Last year we stood at the Holiday Inn on 6?th street, I chose this hotel for the price even though it was only about $100 difference,never again, the HI at least had a dishwasher,maids that cared, clean rooms and laundry area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!!”
Reviews.Author: webdzin
Reviews.Content: This place is running a racket! We got to our rooms, the floor of our room (614) was 3 inches below the actual entrance...so we had a sign that stated "Please watch your step" posted on the door. To get out onto the balcony you had to step up 8 inches. The wallpaper was molded and torn. The provided 2 fold down chairs and an ironing board that was moldy, rusty, and you needed a tetanus shot to use. The bathroom had moldy grout. There was no pull-up on the faucet to shut the sink and no plug. The shower/tub would not drain. There were stains on our comforter. We tried to move but they said they were sold out and to try the next morning. When we spoke to the front desk the next morning, they said there wasn't a manager on duty...until I showed them (and several other guests) the pictures on my camera of our disgusting room! There were only 2 other rooms available, and one of them was just as bad as ours. So our friends move to the "nicer" room and we stayed in ours. I think if you complain they will move you to a "better" room, and if you don't they will charge you full price. Reminded me of the seedy hotels that we used to stay at during senior week when we were 18! It was horrible! Don't waste your time or money!!!!! I will post some of my pics tonight!

Reviews.Title: “All in all quite disappointed”
Reviews.Author: TK20109
Reviews.Content: For a late summer/early fall getaway we chose this hotel for location and price. The location is right on the boardwalk. The room in a rear building was very cheap for a Sunday night stay. Most guest had left after the weekend, so it wasn't crowded at all. Now, that's about all I can say in favor of this hotel. The entrance in the separate building is narrow, not well lit, and not at all inviting. The single elevator clanked and jerked, but it got us to the right floor. The room we occupied wasn't too clean. It did have freshly laundered linens and the bathroom was clean. However, the bed covering had permanent stains, as did the sheets. The sofa also had stains. I found someone's fingernail clippings on a chair. The carpet didn't appear to have been vacuumed well. In the bathroom, there was a missing tile, glue stains were some patching had taken place, and stains of some sort in the plastic tub. I think the maid did what she could, perhaps too hurriedly and not looking carefully enough, but this building is old and in need of considerable maintenance. The breakfast area is small and the offerings were marginal at best. I have never seen such a grimy waffle maker. Others may have found the staff friendly, but to me the front desk staff were unfriendly and not at all welcoming, actually rude upon check-out. There were surprises at check-out not mentioned at check-in. First, we weren't aware of the $1.50 "safe w/lth warranty" fee. There were three separate taxes, which we expected, but the $4.00 "Resort Fee" was another surprise. This is certainly no resort. It is well below the standards of any other Comfort Inn. Would these be charges for each night? I don't know since we stayed only one night before finding other lodging. So, I cannot recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel and staff made the trip awesome”
Reviews.Author: janinelt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Inn Boardwalk with my husband, toddler, and teen. Our hotel and stay experience was perfect. The staff was kind, extremely helpful and friendly from our first phone call to the hotel and then throughout our entire stay. The person watching the front desk held the door for us as we checked in late at night and the service and kindness never ended. The room was oceanfront and the view was spectacular of the sea and boardwalk. We were entertained by kite loft shows night and day, rain and shine. The location was perfect for my teen to go out on his own when he wanted and it was easy to enjoy the boardwalk with a toddler being right on 5th. Breakfast was nice with dual waffle makers going every morning keeping the kids happy. Great vacation, great place to enjoy! Janine Pappalardo

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced for nothing”
Reviews.Author: onconrse
Reviews.Content: First the pros. The hotel is at a great location; just by the boardwalk and ocean. The room was cleaned well. And that is about all. The negatives: 1. wayyyy overpriced; $723.11 with an employee discount for 3 nights, 2nd to last weekend in August, then was charged $10 a night for parking (first car is free; any additional has to be paid for). Not an ocean view. 2. The pull-out sofa bed had dirty sheets on it. We called the front desk to please come and change the sheets. She said she was too busy but we could come get the sheets ourself (this was at 3am). 3. Cleaning lady arrived when we were still asleep...she quickly emptied trash and exchanged towels...as we were leaving I asked her if she could please clean the room since we were going out...she was pissed off! Ok, now if I had paid $50 a night for a hotel no big deal, but $700+ for 3 nights and this kind of attitude?!? Come on!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but that is where it ends”
Reviews.Author: cthreeb
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Not too close to the high traffic & noisy area (you can walk to the games & rides), Not to far from the food, fun, kites & activities. Hotel has 2 buildings 1 on the boardwalk and 1 on the corner. Corner building is OLD, musty smelling, no security, cloudy pool (indoor), broken locks on patio door, dingy tub and no attendant. The other building has an attendant, outdoor pool, breakfast area, newer elevator. (don't know about the rooms) Great for young people w/o small children. For families w/children, find a nicer/newer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, FANTASTIC staff”
Reviews.Author: dpg9300
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just next to the Kite Loft, which added to the wonderful view. The staff (particularly Darrin - hope I spelled it correctly) at the front desk went above and beyond to be helpful and make our stay pleasant and productive. This hotel was cleaner than most beachfront properties (even some much pricier resorts), the housekeeping staff were consistent, breakfast was sufficient enough that we didn't leave hungry...I just don't have any complaints about this place. It was well worth the money and we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: bjd222
Reviews.Content: I am not that picky about my hotels and rarely write reviews. My room in this hotel had empty soda cans laying around and used toilet paper around the toilet. The couch had blood stains. I did not feel safe as my balcony connected to two on either side with a 3 ft divider- anyone could hop over and the lock on the door would not be a challenge. It also smells really bad everywhere in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend away!”
Reviews.Author: soccermom718
Reviews.Content: From the staff to the rooms I have nothing but good to say about my stay here! We walked in the door and were cheerfully greeted from the three people behind the desk. Within in 10 minutes we were in our very clean room and standing on the balcony looking at the gorgeous view! The staff was so helpful in giving directions and opinons on where to have dinner and things to do. I will definetly stay here again. Thanks Comfort in for a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “PLACE TO SLEEP”
Reviews.Author: rivertown
Reviews.Content: Not bad locatio went for the fall car show. The room wasnt cleaned properly ;looked like a hit and miss more like a miss. In the evening there was always a desk clerk sitting watching TV with there bottle of pop..The breakfast buffet was really good and the staff was also Housekeeping was below par. This hotel has a great location but needs updated and that something extra

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here multiple times...”
Reviews.Author: Rjenki961
Reviews.Content: My family, as well as extended family, have stayed at the Comfort Inn Boardwalk on multiple occasions. The hotel is very clean, staff is very helpful and friendly, serves a nice continental breakfast with hot coffee 24 hrs a day. We always have stayed in oceanfront rooms on the first floor (looking right out at the boardwalk and ocean) so I cannot attest to the other rooms in the main building or the rooms in the back building. Our rooms have always been spacious, clean, and comfortable. This is a higher priced hotel than some on the boardwalk, however we are able to fit more people (six to the rooms we rented) and because it's an efficiency we didn't spend as much money on food during our visit. There is a smaller pool in front of the hotel (between the balcony and boardwalk). I have never used that pool but my family has and they say the water is cold. The indoor pool in the back building is nice and warm and clean. I can compare this place to several other places we've stayed in OC. We've stayed at the Plim Plaza multiple times. I really like the atmosphere and porch at the PP but the rooms are very very small. this year we need room for six people and would have had to get two rooms at the PP. Their biggest room is for four people. We would have had to spend almost twice as much to stay there so we are going back to the Comfort Inn this year. We have also rented a very nice oceanfront apartment up on 52nd street. It was big enough to sleep 12 so we shared it and the cost with my brother and his family. It was very nice having our own "space" big enough for ALL of us and cost us no more than renting two side-by-side rooms at the Comfort Inn however it was on 52nd street and we like the boardwalk atmosphere. I do want to comment on one of the posts above. the poster said, "two large outdoor pools and an inddor pool) and a jaccuzzi, but also a sauna, an excersize room equipped with Nautilus (!) circuit training equipment, and a tanning bed." I do have to say that I have stayed at this hotel multiple times between 2006 and 2009 and have never noticed any of the things the other reviewer mentioned. There is only one smaller outdoor pool and one indoor pool. There is no jacuzzi, sauna, exercise room, or tanning bed. There was also no restaurant as the above reviewer mentioned. I wonder if they got their hotels mixed up. I mention these things only so that people are not misguided. Overall though I HIGHLY recommend this hotel! We are staying there again this year!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.Ok Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andee1678
Reviews.Content: The check in went very smooth. The staff was friendly. It wasn't the nicest hotel I've stayed at, but it wasn't the worst either. The room was a good size. The bed was very comfy. We couldn't hear any of the other guests while we were in our room. They had a free breakfast in the morning, which was continuously restocked. They also have waffle batter and waffle irons. That was nice to have something more than cereal and muffins. We found the location to be perfect. It backs right up to the ocean and there are many shops and restaurants in either direction on the boardwalk. I didn't go to the OC to stay in my hotel room, so I was pleased. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Busy but Close to the Beach Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WendyMc
Reviews.Content: You never know what you're going to get with a Comfort Inn. Some are real nice, others not. This one had it's pros and cons. It is very close to the boardwalk and beach. It also had two pools, one inside and one out. The customer service at reception was awesome, they were all very helpful. I saw a different person down there each time I went as we stayed for three nights, but they all were extremely helpful and courteous. The cons, which I never made a big deal about to the staff, were it could of been kept a little cleaner. I know it's a really busy hotel and it probably is hard to keep up but some of the furniture is pretty banged up. The walls had spills marks on them, which I find pretty gross. The alarm clock did not work at all and you had to hold the blow dryer's "on" button the entire time. Our room was set up quite nicely, however, with two queens and a pull out sofa. Also had a microwave and fridge. As always, though, the breakfast is always so jam-packed with people that you almost don't want to get it there but everyone suffers through it because it's free. That happens at all the Comfort Inns I've been to. To sum up, I tried to overlook the flaws because there were so many good things about this place too.

Reviews.Title: “Good motel in great location”
Reviews.Author: greenwel
Reviews.Content: Good Comfort Inn in a great location. Had an oceanfront room with small kitchen. Room was great - had double beds and small living room area with balcony overlooking ocean (GREAT view - kite shop next door keeps kites flying during daytime as well as view of beach and boardwalk). Personnel were all very helpful and nice. Breakfast was waffles, assorted cereals, fruit, danish, muffins, cheese, juices, milk, coffees and area was nice. Only problem we had was there were items left in refrigerator from a previous visit that we felt should have been cleaned out when room was cleaned. Would definitely stay here again!! Wonderful stay

Reviews.Title: “Just okay,not worth more than $100/night”
Reviews.Author: Fairviews
Reviews.Content: Luckily we got this king/sofa partial ocean view on Hotels.com for $92/night. It was just an average old hotel. The indoor pool was a green swamp(we wanted to use this since it was raining)we went to the front desk and they told us they just shocked it an would be better in 10 hours. They didn't have it closed but no way should anyone be in it after just putting a bunch of chemicals in. No filter was running and it had bubbles and a greasy film on top. The room was just average, but the bathroom was very outdated and there were hairs on the toilet and floor. The location was great. You walked out the back and onto the beach. The Kite Loft is next door which is a cool place to go into. The breakfast was okay. Very crowded area. It had cereal,muffins,bagels,and waffles. The staff was nice. They did give us an early check in and the housekeeping staff made sure we had enough blankets/pillows when we checked in. I probably would only stay here again if I got a really cheap price. This room is usually $300 and I would have died if I paid that much for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Ocean City boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: usaf29
Reviews.Content: Ocean City is a good place to stay to stay if you want to stay in an oceanfront hotel. I personally didn't find the boarwalk all that interesting as most shops/stores/restaurants were closed for the winter. It was just a lot of walking for nothing. However, go 30 miles north up US Hwy 1 to Rebohoth, DE to Tanger outlets is a must see. 130 stores in one location! Cracker Barrell in that town. The beach driving up the coast in DE with sand dunes looked much prettier than MDs. Pay $4 (self-pay, envelope) to park anywhere in DE beach though. In terms of the Comfort Inn Boardwalk, it is a great location, warm indoor pool, ample breakfast, with a nice looking lobby. Found in room floor = sock, hose, ziploc bag with hairpins & bottle water under edge of bed, otherwise generally clean. Room had stove top, utensils, fridge, etc. Food prices are way too expensive in Ocean City/boarwalk. Beach shops in OC are cheap. Again if going there, do your thing in OC & drive north to DE factory outlet malls...

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: pagejoyce
Reviews.Content: We stayed at your motel again and was surprised with how the lobby had been redone and loved the breakfast buffet. We never had to go out for breakfast. We have probably stayed at your motel 5 or 6 times in the last 10 years or so. We always try to get a room there and if available an ocean front room. This year we had a side room which also had a great veiw of the ocean since we were on the 5th floor. The rooms are always clean and fresh and the staff is always helpful and friendly. We are looking forward to staying with you again and again. Keep up the great work. A satisfied guest, Mr. & Mrs. Page

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain”
Reviews.Author: jimini1012
Reviews.Content: It's not exactly a five star hotel, but it's decent enough to keep me coming back next time for my yearly visit to Ocean City. I've been here twice, both during summer season and off season. I haven't been disappointed both times. I guess it wouldn't hurt to update the rooms, though I think it's fine right now. The rooms were clean, and the staff were very nice. Location is also a good thing about this hotel since it's right on the boardwalk. Pricing is decent considering the location. The only downside I would say is that the indoor pool looked very muggy and disgusting (I didn't use the indoor pool because of it) and during their breakfast, I found ants on their bagels and muffins. Other than that... I can't complain. I can live without the indoor pool or their breakfast since I usually bring plenty of food with me.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Linjons
Reviews.Content: My husband & I recently stayed at this hotel for 2 nights over a long weekend. We paid a premium for an oceanfront room - and we got one. But the hotel, and the room, were tired and worn - I agree with other reviews that it is badly in need of renovation. It was none to clean either, and the breakfast was crowded and minimal. I quess because their location is so good they get away with charging exhorbitant prices for a product that is no where near worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A good value in spite of housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: Shadowlane
Reviews.Content: Overall, we enjoyed our stay here; you get what you pay for. At first, I was dismayed that our "ocean view" room meant we had to lean over the balcony railing and look to the left to see the beach. The view straight off the balcony was of the building next door- and we looked directly into someone's room! Since we were only there for 2 days, we decided to stay put. Resigned to keeping the curtains closed most of the time, we again turned our attention to the beach. Now we focused on the many kites tethered outside the Kite Loft next door, plus a lively beach volleyball game in progress. What fun! And for the first time, we did not have to drive anywhere- the 5th street location is central to many things. Now the housekeeping part: the stove light bulb was missing, the bathroom vent and hairdryer filter were filthy, there was a theater ticket (Ratatouille) from July on a kitchen chair, a piece of dried-up processed cheese was on the kitchen floor, and a cup of cigarette butts in some sort of yellow liquid sat on the balcony of our non-smoking room. And the room phone didn't work (we had cells, but needed to call the front desk- had to walk down). OK, I feel better now :) Back to the good side: the front desk guys were nice, this hotel had a wonderfully warm and not-too-chlorinated indoor pool (it was aptly described as "a womb"), and they had a terrific continental breakfast with lots of good coffee, fruit, cereal, muffins, and a waffle iron with plenty of pre-mixed cups of batter. Yummy! All in all, a good stay for a lower-budget hotel. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect time of year for this great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: beachgoer2007
Reviews.Content: Great location! Maids were very courteous as was the rest of the staff. Breakfast wasn't bad for continental- you could make waffles and there was plenty of coffee. Priceline deal was pretty good. Room was what I expected for the price and for a room with a "street" view we had a pretty good view of the ocean! Will stay here again as the location was one of the best on the boardwalk. Indoor pool was great and outdoor wasn't bad either!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: LauraBB
Reviews.Content: The location and view was the highlight of this hotel. We were on the 5th/top floor, and had an excellent view of the ocean and boardwalk. The rooms had small refrigerators, which was nice. The room had a strange odor – a mix of BO and fruit spray smells. We paid $245 after tax and everything, which I guess is the going rate for such a superb location and a room with 4 adults. Overall, everything seemed a little dirty and it is impossible to remove the sand from the carpet and nooks and crannies. I would stay here again if I could get a better rate. Next time I will try to booker sooner to get a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & a Great price”
Reviews.Author: KIMandMICHAEL
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice hotel close to the boardwalk to take our son on an overnight trip for his 18th birthday on June 6 - June 7. Based on the location & price, I would give this hotel 10 stars for price, location, & features. Bathrooms are a bit small but then again you just need to shower & clean up in there!!! The shower was "made bigger" by having the bowed shower rod/curtain, which is a great feature. We had two very comfortable queen beds, a small fridge, microwave, & a decent size balcony. I would & will definately stay here again & have no reservations about recommending it to my friends & family. The staff was vert friendly & the front desk was quick to fix a rate issue with me with no problems or arguements. I wish I had gotten the guys name so that I could give him the proper credit for keeping a customer satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “will definately go back, Amy Evans Monroeville,PA”
Reviews.Author: amy71p
Reviews.Content: American owned and operated, this was very nice for us. EVERYONE there was very nice and accomidating. We had stayed at a hotel prior to this night and it was awful, it was so nice to have fast check-in and local help who new the area and where able to point us in the right direction. Even the rooms not on the ocean side were very scenic. I will for sure being going back there every year and may even bring the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: mommy2cheyenne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in May for just $300 !. We had a room with an ocean view (not ocean front) which means you can see the ocean from your balcony. We were in the building with the pool. It was great that they had a pool because some of the days were just too chilly to swim in the ocean. The location is great..close to the inlet, but not too close. I'm getting ready to book again for next summer. Also, check out JR's for dinner...just up the main road! Very nice, but kid friendly! Check out there website for the deal we got. [----] I hope this review has been helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: elmjr
Reviews.Content: I have nothing negative to say about the Comfort Inn. We stayed there Aug.7 thru the 10. Our room was on the 4th floor ocean front. The room was clean and well supplied every day. Everything worked and we did have a microwave. My husband especially liked having a separate seating area with a sofa and coffee table to watch tv(which had many channels including HBO) and a wall safe. The staff was coutreous and friendly. There was always a parking space in their lot. Breakfast was more than enough and well stocked to get you started for the day. You could eat out side or take it back up to your room and eat. If you wanted a hot breakfast you could eat out or make it in your kitchen. If you didn't feel like making coffee you could always fill your coffee pot in the lobby and take it back up to your room. There was an ice machine for your use. Our grandsons loved the pool. It was clean early every morning. The location was great not to far from the amusements but far enough that it was quiet. The price was reasonable for ocean front in Aug. It was a great vacation in fact our grandsons asked if we could stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: suie1
Reviews.Content: It was terrible at the Comfort Suites on the Boardwalk Ocean City MD start off with the room; one of light fixtures on the wall was completely broken below where the ligh screws in exposing the wires a definate fire hazard; the other lights had bulbs burned out. room was dirty; rust on the heating and cooling registers coffee pot supplied in the room held 2oz only of coffee; not even worth filling with coffee grounds; they had coffee in the lobby and the staff insisted ya take the "bottom of the Pot" grounds as a cup of coffee. they advertised wifi wireless internet access high speed; could never get online only after always calling down to desk first were we able to get online (had to reset their router) definately was not high speed acccess as they advertised. only free channel on tv was HBO not HBO, Disney and Cinenax they advertised. when I checked in; they charged me extra for one of guests even though, when I made reservations; the ages were put on the reservation; they still charged me extra for one of my guests than when I checked out; they advertised you get awarded flying miles for staying; so I presented them with my miles card from airline and had dificulty getting my card back when I left. I had to get upset before they surrendered my card back to me. the whole experience was upsetting and this was after paying 278.00 dollars a night at this hotel!!! beware, do not stay there complete rip off

Reviews.Title: “go elsewhere, we did”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our reservaions were for 3 nights but we checked out after the first night. The rooms smelled musty. The toilet overflowed. Ran out of hot water. The bedding smelled awful. We asked for clean bedding which wasn't any better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price”
Reviews.Author: DavyGGG
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on Oct 28, 2005. Great Hotel ! Large, clean room right on the ocean. Large Bathroom, plenty of towels etc. very friendly staff, very safe secure place to stay. Free Breakfast [Coffee, juice, cereal, Danish, Muffins and a free USA Today. Would Stay Again

Reviews.Title: “It was just OK”
Reviews.Author: Penney1000
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a one night stay (9-29-05) at the Comfort Inn Boardwalk in Ocean City. We were in room 101, oceanfront. This room is directly in front of the lounges and the pool. We were informed of this when we booked, but were told the pool closed at 6 pm. It was cool out so we did not have to worry about anyone swimming. However, if this were summer I would never book a room on the ground floor. Too noisy, everyone can see right in your room, no privacy whatsoever. Our room was OK, 2 double beds (why every hotel doesn't have queens I do not know), a sleeper sofa, small equipped kitchen and fairly good sized bathroom. Our problems were these - property is older, carpet in halls needs to be replaced, there is sand along the baseboards, our room had several areas where the wallpaper was sticking up, the room needed a good dusting, fixtures were dusty, toilet paper holder was dusty and above all the dustiest thing was the plastic case the hairdryer was in. There was something wrong with the drain in the tub, it was shut and it could not be opened, hence the tub never drained and you had to stand in water to shower. I would of said more, but we only stayed for 1 night. The breakfast is meager, orange juice was so watered down it did not even taste like juice, the pastries were tiny and so were the bagels. One good thing was the man who was at the desk when we checked in - he was very nice and helpful. I am not sure we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 went to Comfort Inn O C Boardwalk. It was ok for our needs but I thought it was overpriced for what you get. Of course Ocean City is overpriced. The room said oceanview and the building we were in was behind the oceanfront building and the view was from the side over the balcony. The cleaning was not very good. The same dirt was under the sink in the bathroom the entire time. They only cleaned the high surfaces. The room itself was fine and the balcony pretty nice. The location is great, but it was a disappointment for the hefty price.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: Helen5
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed at the Comfort Inn Boardwalk - you couldn't ask for a better location! Located at the southern end of the boardwalk -close (but not too close!) to where all the shops and amusements are. Great outdoor pool - right on the boardwalk. Just a few steps from the beach. The room was very nice - 2 queen beds and a sofa bed. Nice kitchenette area (with dishes and silverware). The only complaint is the continental breakfast - small bagels, mini muffins, small danish wrapped in plastic, 2 choices of cereal and some fruit. But the rest of the place was great! I would definetely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful...highly recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: gracemore7
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a last minute weekend trip to the beach before school started and wanted to try and stay somewhere right near the heart of the boardwalk for a change. We were quite nervous and weren't sure what to expect, since we always tried to avoid staying anywhere near the Boardwalk when the kids were younger. To our surprise, we enjoyed ourselves more than ever before and will never stay away from the boardwalk again! The convenience was pricelss and it was no where near as crazy as we had thought it would be. We were pleasantly surprised when we first walked into our hotel room to find an extremely clean and modern room. The sheets, blankets, pillows and towels were of good quality. The air conditioner was brand new and the room was ice cold. Kitchenette was perfect and all new appliances. The water pressure was fantastic! Great indoor pool. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. Continental breakfast was fabulous. Fresh bagels, fruits, danishes, various muffins and cereal, an abundance of them each morning! The location could not have been better! Right next door was the Kite Loft so we woke up each morning to the beautiful display of kites on the beach. Bike rentals were also right next door as well as shops galore and The Dough Roller just a couple of streets away! No more driving or long walks to the heart of the Boardwalk! It was surprisingly very peaceful and quiet at night and the ocean front rooms had spectacular views of the ocean! The hotel and trip couldn't have been a better experience for all of us. We would definately stay again and highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn Boardwalk
HotelInfo.Address: 507 Atlantic Avenue @ 5th St & Oceanfront, Ocean City, MD 21842
